title: Bug 34399 Undeploy fails when context defined in server.xml & server fails to stop
description: Steps to reproduce:1. autodeploy a web application by defining its context in server.xml2. start the Tomcat server3. use the Tomcat Manager to undeploy the applicationYou will get the "OK  Undeployed application at context path /WebApplication"message, but the application will NOT be deployed, it will be only stopped.If you try to stop the server after that, it will fail!I have used the shared installation (CATALINABASE dir), but I guess thiswon't work for standalone Tomcat installation either.
